name: Holiday Inn Resort Pensacola Beach Gulf Front

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Holiday Inn on the beach for a family vacation. This hotel is practically new (as of 2012). This hotel is great for families, especially those with younger kids; singles and couples looking for a "romantic getaway" would be better off choosing a different hotel. There's a "lazy river" in the pool, along with mock pirate battles. The deepest the pool gets is about 5 feet. There's also a small indoor "pool" (which is about 15 feet square). A short walk over the dunes brings you to the beach.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but avoid the restaurant

reviews.text: The only downside was the restaurant. The speed and service in the hotel restaurant were absolutely abysmal. On our first night, we went for dinner and had to ask the waitress multiple times for drink orders or to have orders corrected or drinks refilled. Half the dinner came out and then the other half came out 20 minutes later. The next day, we went at lunch and, although the service was much better, we had a similar experience when it comes to speed. We must have waited 45 minutes for a relatively simple order to come out and, even then, all but one of them came out. One person in our party had to wait another 15-20 minutes to get their meal while the rest of us either ate or waited to be polite.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: So overall, I'd recommend the hotel itself, but I'd recommend guests avoid the restaurant and instead walk across the street. There's a pizza and Italian restaurant immediately across from the hotel and, just down the street is the boardwalk with tons of restaurant choices.
reviews.title: Nice hotel hard for a long time

reviews.text: AWESOME stay, I was here for a week on buisness and it was great, The view and pool area is awesome. Staff is some of the best in regards to being polite, courteous and helpful. The facility has a very nice lounge. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Combination

reviews.text: This hotel is awesome for kids!! Breakfeast is not complementary but kids eat free every meal with a paying adult. The food is average beach food not bad at all. This hotel has a movie every night by the pool and a daily pirate and mermaid. We had a kid suite with bunk beds and there own tv with x box. It was a perfect room except for no way to cook except for a microwave and mini fridge. We spent the majority of our time in the pool and lazy river however the each is steps away from the hotel and beautiful might I ad. Everyone here tries there best to help and the pool area is a huge plus! It is kind of pricey but we stayed on our holiday inn points so if you choose this hotel make sure to enroll in this program for future stays otherwise its around 300.00 per night.
reviews.title: Wonderful family vacation destination!

reviews.text: What a great place to stay while on the Gulf coast. Our grandchildren were treated like royalty! Would highly recommend for children of all ages!!!!!!!
reviews.title: GREAT VACATION HOTEL

reviews.text: We had an amazing time for the most part! ill start with what made the trip a little difficult. We are priority rewards members through Holiday Inn. We only had enough points to do a points plus cash night and then we bought a couple of extra nights. I dont think they could have made it anymore difficult because for whatever reason they wouldnt let me do it online. I called the 1800 number and so the lady helped me book the 2 nights we were paying full price for and then assured me I could then go back online and do the priority points night on my own. And of course that didnt happen because the weekend we went you had to book at least 2 nights in a row, which i was trying to do but i had to book my stay with two seperate reservations. After being on the phone for a minimum of an hour, it was finally figured out. The only other bad experience was, we accidently left a bag in the room. After multiple phone calls I finally got a hold of the housekeeping manager and was able to pick up my bag, but instead of my brand new chuck taylors being in the bag, they were replaced with some funking joe boxer flipflops....at least everything else was in the bag, just a little weird! Now for the GOOD STUFF! This hotel is AMAZING! My three kids had an awesome time at the pool! For my two boys, Pirates came out everyday and interacted with the kids, there was sword fighting and a treasure hunt! For my daughter there was a mermaid that swam with kids and she would do their makeup! The lazy river was very relaxing and there were plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas to go around! If you felt like having a drink, the bar was steps away....a little pricey though! We ate at the restaurant and the food was awesome! They had the best salsa! The best part was that the kids ate free. The hotel staff was nice and the room was amazing! We had a corner room and we had an almost panaramic view of the island. I have some awesome pics! The location of the hotel is prime....everything is in walking distance. We had a wonderful time and wil def be coming back, I just wont forget my bag this time!
reviews.title: Kids had a blast!!

reviews.text: We spent a week here and overall it was a nice experience. Check in was pretty easy as it is a busy hotel in the heart of Pensacola Beach. The Hotel has an amazing pool with a lazy river and it located directly on the beach. The resturant on property Riptides is pretty good overall and kids eat free which is very nice. The prices for adults are'nt too bad either. The rooms were nice and clean as it is a new hotel. It is located in a great part of the strip near everything and there is a giant new ferris wheel right across the street. Overall it is a good place to stay and is one of the better locations on Pensacola Beach.
reviews.title: Unbias Review
Needs work in the "warm -hospitality -customer service department."
reviews.text: Now for the not so good. The housekeeping crew was stingy with towels and wash rags. We kept having to ask for some on a daily basis. Also, there is little or no activities for children. Yes there is a gameroom which is the size of my bathroom, but there isnt any real organized children's activites other than a mermaid and pirate that appear briefly. The movie night they speak of was nowhere to be found so I cant comment on that. It would have been nice if they did more things with the kids but its not a show stopper.
Overall this is a very good place to stay and is one of the better places to stay when in Pensacola Beach!!
reviews.title: Thought a lot about this review

reviews.text: This was a beautiful luxurious hotel. The lazy river pool was its finest amenity and a huge hit with the whole family. I loved the bar being close by. The drinks were amazing and reasonably priced. The rooms were average for this type of hotel and very clean.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed there with some friends. They had kids, we did not. We payed $236 for a ocean view room. Room was clean and nice. View was perfect. The hotel caters to kids. I felt like if I asked the hotel staff a hotel question, they would be confused. But ask for a balloon animal and candy and poof, it appears. They did a movie at the pool in the PM and the whole pool area is super kid frinedly. Quick walk to the beach cuts most kids out of the picture. Managment works really hard keeping this place running with all the people that come through here. ITs deff a place you could stay and not leave. 236 was tuff to swallow. Wife and I could go on a cruise for that much. If I had to stay in pensacola beach again with kids, would stay here again. No kids, would shop for a more adult hotel. Im not really a kid person and never felt to over welm.
reviews.title: Great for kids, breakfast really good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just like the title says. We just had an eh stay at this resort. The rooms were nice because this is a fairly new property but the service was less than standard. Because I am an older lady, I do not have a facebook and felt as if i was pressured to have one and because I didnt I felt as if I was looked at poorly by their staff. They try to solicit good comments about their hotel. Didn't know that was the way to run a business.
reviews.title: Eh

reviews.text: My brother and I are adults and stayed at this hotel with our parents. It was great!! We had a gulf front room and the view was awesome. Even on the bay view side, there are still great views. The main drawback is the bay view rooms don't have balconies. The lazy river was very fun and the landscaping is pretty. The pool was nice and warm. It would be nice if they limited the lazy river to only those in tubes though because it was filled with kids swimming through and under you. The hotel is decorated beautifully. It doesn't even feel like a hotel. The resort buffet breakfast was outstanding and also included free made to order eggs, pancakes, and waffles in addition to a ton of choices on the buffet. The grounds of the resort were nice and it was in a central location. It is very pricey though.
reviews.title: Expensive, awesome hotel with great view & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed at this resort for a three day weekend. I was a bit skeptical after reading so many not-so-great reviews here but we chanced it anyway. My husband is a member of the Holiday Inn rewards program so this was a reward points stay. When we arrived I was impressed with the lobby--very clean and modern. We were upgraded to a room on the 10th floor with a ocean view balcony, which was nice. I was a bit disappointed that the room was 2 queen beds instead of a king but the view was so great it made up for it. The room was nice and clean. The only issue we had with the room was with the wi-fi...it was incredibly slow and actually rarely worked at all. Thankfully we had our iPad and iPhones with 3G so that we were able to look up menus and make restaurant reservations. We didn't spend a lot of time at the pool, just a short time in the hot tub but it was enjoyable. The outdoor bar was very nice and the bartenders were great. Gave us many great recommendations for restaurants and drinks. The beach in front of the hotel was great. Very clean and large. The location of this hotel is wonderful--right in the middle of lots of great restaurants, great spot on the beach, near nightlife.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: My wife and two young boys stayed 4 nites this past week. This place is awesome!!! The whole family loved the lazy river pool and the beach is prettier than Panama City or Gulf Shores. The location is great for seafood and gift shopping. After reading some of the few negative reviews I just have to shake my head. I guess you can't please some people no matter what. Elevators and wifi were NOT slow,(what OCD wrote that? LOL)and service was outstanding. Short walk down to pier was fun. A great experience!! My six yr old son has asked 20 times "when are we going back?"
reviews.title: July/August vacation

reviews.text: We went to Pensacola with my family of four and stayed 2 nights on the bay side of the hotel. We were on the 10th floor and the view of the bay was nice. The hotel was clean and staff very attentive. The beds were comfortable and having a refrigerator was very nice. The mermaid and pirate were fun for the kids. We enjoyed the pool and beach. Would recommend renting beach chairs. Easy walk to lots of restraunts. Parked the car when we checked in and didn't get back in until we checked out. Would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend family get away

reviews.text: Overall, this was a fantastic resort to take your family. Amenities galore for the children and the food was really, really good. BUT, if you want your room serviced, well don't hold your breath. It may or may not happen. Had to request towels on more than one occasion, stingey with the coffee and had to tell them that yes, we want the beds made. Especially at their prices. The personnel was terrific, just not enough of them, causing long waits for tables and food to arrive. I would return in a heartbeat for the children, not so much for just my husband and I.
reviews.title: childrens paradise

reviews.text: I've stayed twice now at this property and both times have had a wonderful time. I've done both an oceanside room and a soundside room. I enjoyed our oceanside room slightly better due to the better shower, but both rooms were great. The room had a coffeemaker, a nice hair dryer, refrigerator and safe. We called to ask for toothpaste the first night and I don't think it took more than 90 seconds for them to knock on our door with it. Elevators are slow and hard to get sometimes, especially since housekeeping uses the one on the far left. I really think they should have had their own elevator built somewhere else into the building because I can't tell you how many times we had to miss an elevator because that one was full of housekeeping staff and supplies, then wait even longer for another elevator to even stop at our floor. But that's small potatoes relative to everything else. The staff is friendly and welcoming. There is a pirate show and a mermaid that comes out to interact with the kids at the pool. The pool itself is wonderful with the lazy river. They do not make people vacate the pool when bad weather is moving in, which I did find to be a safety concern, but I was also smart enough to get out of and away from the pool. Beach access is directly from the pool area. This is just a perfect place to stay in PCB. We will return again and again. The boardwalk and several other restaurants are within walking distance, so just park your car and walk everywhere you can to avoid the traffic.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in PCB

reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at the Holiday Inn Resort. We arrived about 4 hours before check-in time and they made us feel right at home. Gave us everything we needed to enjoy the amenities while we waited on our room. Loved the pool, lazy river, tiki hut, convenient walk to the beach, everything! The Riptides restaurant was a little pricey, but it was convenient, really good food, and the service was excellent! Wish we were still there. Rooms very comfortable, didn't hear any outside hall noise, or overhead walking noise from room above. Hotel was packed, but everybody was spread out that it didn't feel crowded. It was just such a wonderful time. My new favorite place to stay in Pensacola Beach. Counting the days until we get to go back.
reviews.title: Wish I was still there!

aka: Holiday Inn Resort Pensacola Beach Gulf Front Hotel Pensacola Beach
description: Beachfront rooms enjoy panoramic views of emerald green waters of the Gulf of Mexico and 52 miles of sugar white sand. We have the best pool on Pensacola Beach with a 250 foot lazy river, cascading waterfall & 2 hot tubs. Other amenities include Riptides Sports Grill & beachfront Tiki bar, beach view fitness center, and family suites. Seasonally we offer ‘Dive Inn’ evening movies, supervised children’s activities, mermaids and pirates. Additionally we have some of the very best views on the beach.
